title: How to Share Your Location on Viber: Android & iPhone Guide

steps.title: Start or open a chat in Viber.
steps.content: Start or open a chat in Viber. Select a chat with the person or people you want to share your location with, or tap the Chats icon (the purple bubble with a white speech bubble inside) to create a new chat. The chat window will appear. If Viber doesn't open to the Chats tab, tap Chats at the bottom-left corner to go there first. Use this method to send your location once to the person you're chatting with.

steps.title: Tap +.
steps.content: Tap + . This opens a window that contains several options.

steps.title: Tap Location.
steps.content: Tap Location . This opens a map that will zoom in to your current location if Viber has permission to access it. If Viber cannot access your location, you'll be prompted to enable location sharing for Viber in your phone's settings. If you need to adjust the map, you can tap it to view it full screen, then tap and drag the map to the correct location. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Enable location sharing for Viber.
steps.content: Enable location sharing for Viber. If you've already given Viber permission to access your location, you can skip this step. Otherwise, if you're using an Android, tap Continue , then toggle on "Location access" or "Use location" for Viber. [2] X Research source If you're using an iPhone, choose how you want to enable location access, such as While Using the App or Always . When you're finished, tap the back button to return to Viber.

steps.title: Tap Send location or Send to share your location.
steps.content: Tap Send location or Send to share your location. If you have an Android, it'll be at the bottom of the map. On an iPhone, you'll see Send in the top right. This sends your current location to the chat in Viber.

steps.title: Start or open a chat.
steps.content: Start or open a chat. Select a chat with the person or people you want to share your location with, or tap the Chats icon (the purple bubble with a white speech bubble inside) to create a new chat. The chat window will appear. Use this method if you want to share your live location each time you send a message to the chat. When this feature is enabled, a location pushpin will appear on each of your messages–anyone in the chat will be able to tap the pushpin to see where you were when you sent the message.

steps.title: Tap the three dots at the top-right corner ⋮.
steps.content: Tap the three dots at the top-right corner ⋮ . A menu will expand.

steps.title: Scroll down and toggle on "Attach location always."
steps.content: Scroll down and toggle on "Attach location always." Now you'll see a location pin on every one of your messages in the chat. [3] X Research source If prompted, follow the on-screen instructions to give Viber permission to access your location. To stop sharing your location, return to this menu, then toggle the switch to the Off position.

steps.title: Android
steps.content: Android If you don't want Viber to have access to your location at all, you can take away Viber's location permissions in your Android settings. Here's how: Open your Android's Settings . Tap Location . Tap App location permissions or App permissions (Samsung). Select Viber from the list. Select Don't allow . [4] X Research source

steps.title: iPhone
steps.content: iPhone To stop allowing Viber to access your location, you can disable Viber's location permissions in your settings. Here's what to do: Open your iPhone's Settings . Tap Privacy & Security . Tap Location Services . Select Viber . Select Never . [5] X Research source

steps.title: Why is Viber showing my location?
steps.content: Why is Viber showing my location? If you've enabled location sharing in Viber, Viber will show your location until you turn the feature off. To stop sharing your live location, open the chat in which you're sharing your location, tap the three dots at the top-right, then toggle off "Attach location always."

steps.title: What does "the system could not identify your location" on Viber mean?
steps.content: What does "the system could not identify your location" on Viber mean? If you see this error when you try to send a message in Viber, it's usually because you're using an Android phone or tablet running a third-party privacy app that blocks your location from all apps. Disable location blocking in your privacy app to fix the problem.

steps.title: Can people find me on Viber?
steps.content: Can people find me on Viber? If another Viber user has you in their phone contacts, they will be able to find you on Viber. Unfortunately, there is no way to make it so people can't find you on Viber if they have your phone number.
